msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto;Some writing on Verso
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut in two cuts at the left hand side.kollesis at the middle of the papyrus, before the column. The papyrus is damaged and mutilated as a result of a fold at the middle of col. 146. Generaly, it is damaged from top and bottom; a big lacuna at the middle; strips of fibers are frayed at the top of the right side. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated the new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer and marking an oblique stroke going downwards to the left margin in other lines.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Taseus, son of Petalos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 238)
Maron, son of Limnaios, grandson of Maron, mother Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 186)
Serenus, son of Apolinarius (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 229)
Isidoros, son of Petesouchos, grandson of Petesouchos, mother Tasoucharion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 179)
Mysthes, son of Petheus, grandson of Mysthes, mother Tasoucharion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 189)
Sarapion, son of Sarapion the elder, grandson of Papos, mother Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 225)
Kastor alias, Ptolemaios, son of Ptolemaios, grandson of Kastor, Tasoucharion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 182)
Areios and Ptolemaios, sons of Sarapion and Polydeukes (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 154
Longinus, son of Priskos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 185)
Papontos, son of Petheus (Titilebie) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 197)
Julia, daughter of Heras previously (called) Thermouthis alias Tpaietis, daughter of Petesouchos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 178)
(Sabinus son of Patron) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 222)
Petsiris, son of Seleukos (Petsiris the wine merchant) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 211)
Achillas, son of Ptollis, grandson of Hieranouphis, mother Thermouthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 158)
Ptolemaios, son of Artemidoros, grandson of Petheus, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 216)
Onnophris, son of Petheus, grandson of Petheus, mother Taonnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 192)
Kastor, the son, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 182)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: Lourianes;the 92nd cleruchy;the property of Psenarpsenesis Maikenatiane
